Posts.Content: Squirrel62 wrote: I have been battling my reoccurence since last October.  I have mets in my liver and lymph node behind my chest wall so started with Taxol until that stopped working, then Gemzar until that stopped working.  I tolerated those drugs really well and held a pretty normal life but starting mid October I began Doxil and have felt awful since.  I now have mets on my spine and lungs and have to get fluid drawn from my chest cavity next week.  The fluid is making me cough, short of breath, unable to eat much which is not neccesarily a bad thing....I have weight to lose  :-)  so now my special Onc is starting me on a new chemo called Ixempra.  Has anyone had it and does anyone have any words of wisdom? Thanks.  I am going through a rough patch my doc says but I think sometimes you have to hit the rough to get back to the smooth....forever fighting!! Dx 10/10/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/12 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Starting Ixempra Squirrel62 Squirrel62

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2009 12:02PM - edited Dec 1, 2009 12:05PM by Squirrel62 Thanks so much for the good wishes.  Taxol worked for about 5 months and then I started Gemzar and that worked for 8 months which was very encouraging. Doxil was the next drug that did nothing for me.  I will keep you posted on how the Ixempra goes.  I am not on a clinical trial but who knows what the future holds.  I am thankful for each day!   Hoping the best for you all  too!
Posts.Title: Starting Ixempra Squirrel62 Squirrel62

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2009 11:42AM Squirrel62 wrote: I do not know what hormonal TX is so no I so not think I have tried that.
